title: Model-Based AI and Explainability Focus
summary: First CAIO appointment signals AI as central nervous system of future business, with focus on explainable AI for regulated industries

content.whatItIs: UBS appointed Daniele Magazzeni as its first Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer effective January 1, 2026—signaling AI is no longer peripheral but 'the central nervous system of its future business model.'
howItWorks: Strategic hire from J.P. Morgan where Magazzeni was Chief Analytics Officer for EMEA and helped secure top Evident Banking AI Index spot
Expertise in 'Model-Based AI' and 'Explainable AI' (XAI)—critical for regulated industries where 'black box' algorithms are liabilities
Chief AI Office responsible for effective deployment at scale, consistent standards, and strong technological foundations
Reports to Group Chief Operations and Technology Officer
300+ live AI use cases; M365 Copilot and in-house 'Red' AI Assistant rolling out to all employees
content.coreInsight: In regulated industries, the CAIO role must emphasize explainability and governance, not just capability. Hire leaders with both academic AI credentials AND enterprise delivery experience. 'Model-Based AI' and 'Explainable AI' (XAI) become competitive advantages when regulators and clients demand transparency.
content.keyMetrics: 300+ live AI use cases. 'Big Rocks' large-scale transformational initiatives launched 2025. 40%+ of Fortune 500 expected to have CAIO by end of 2026.
